1e3a840b-8ddb-489e-aed9-bbf7d6f26f73.description: The earner of this badge attended a professional development by Dr. Carter Andrews. Dr. Dorinda Carter Andrews is professor and chairperson of the Department of Teacher Education at on racial identity development, urban education, critical multiculturalism, and critical race theory. Dr. Carter-Andrews holds a B.S.I.E. from Georgia Tech, M.Ed. from Vanderbilt University, and an Ed.M. and Ed.D. from Harvard University.
1e3a840b-8ddb-489e-aed9-bbf7d6f26f73.name: Racial Equity and Justice in the Classroom

issuer.summary: issued by Glen Oaks Community College

badge_template_activities.title: This person attended a 3 hour presentation by Dr. Dorinda Carter Andrews from Michigan State University. Learning outcomes included understanding various forms of identity-based inequality at individual, institutional, structural, and systemic levels. Learners will understand and examine implicit bias and racial microaggressions and explore ways to combat discrimination and bias in one's personal and professional life

bd7ae3d3-d150-4b6e-b99a-048b3cb5fc44.description: Alpha Alpha Alpha (Tri-Alpha) is a National Honor Society for First Generation College Students.
bd7ae3d3-d150-4b6e-b99a-048b3cb5fc44.name: Alpha Alpha Alpha Member

issuer.summary: issued by Glen Oaks Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Alpha Alpha Alpha, or Tri-Alpha, was founded March 24, 2018 at Moravian College (now Moravian University) in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. The College then took steps to incorporate Alpha Alpha Alpha so that chapters could be started on other campuses across the country. Tri-Alpha exists as a not-for-profit (501(c)3) organization, for the purposes of supporting the activities of the honors society.
